doc:
An enum for determining the page role inside the . It's used to handle buttons sensitivity and visibility.

Note that an assistant needs to end its page flow with a page of type .confirm, .summary or .progress to be correct.

The Cancel button will only be shown if the page isn’t “committed”. See for details.

members.doc: The page has regular contents. Both the Back and forward buttons will be shown.
members.name: content

members.doc: The page contains an introduction to the assistant task. Only the Forward button will be shown if there is a next page.
members.name: intro

members.doc: The page lets the user confirm or deny the changes. The Back and Apply buttons will be shown.
members.name: confirm

members.doc: The page informs the user of the changes done. Only the Close button will be shown.
members.name: summary

members.doc: Used for tasks that take a long time to complete, blocks the assistant until the page is marked as complete. Only the back button will be shown.
members.name: progress

members.doc: Used for when other page types are not appropriate. No buttons will be shown, and the application must add its own buttons through .
members.name: custom

name: AssistantPageType
